subtitle: Welcome everyone, I hope you're all well and enjoying the channel, it's still growing very fast
we're almost at 3000 subscribers in just almost six months, if you're not subscribed already be
sure to do so so you can keep up with all of these spiritual topics and explorations, and on that note
that brings me on to the subject of this episode which relates to - why do we even feel the need
to read and watch these videos and books in the first place? to pursue spiritual wisdom or
seek guidance from a teacher... doing things like this, as well as doing things like; yoga, meditation,
transmutation, Astral projection, usually has some sort of spiritual goal or objective right? There's
many ways we could call this objective but one of the most common concepts is called Enlightenment.
So I'm going to try and clarify this idea of enlightenment i'm going to explain
what it is, what it is not, and try to point towards the reality of what such a state of consciousness
implies, but you have to keep in mind that ultimately myself or anyone else cannot logically
say what enlightenment actually is, because it is not a logical thing, but we can point towards
its reality, and so it may take more of a subtle, a more deeper state of mind to resonate with
what i'm going to say in this episode, perhaps maybe while you listen you might even shift into
a state of consciousness which is going towards this dimension of enlightenment, if you really
listen, as opposed to thinking or rationalizing about these ideas, so what is enlightenment? and
is enlightenment the end goal? like it so seems in religion such as Buddhism? what actually happens
when we reach a state of enlightenment? these are some of the common questions i get and i was
recently asked about it by a Patreon called Bullwey from the Astral Doorway Discord which led me to
making this video, and he asked these sorts of questions in a very sincere way and i think a lot
of people share the same sentiment about this idea of enlightenment and what it means for our life
and where we're going because this inquiry is natural right? because we all more or less wonder
or think what is the point of all of this? where am i going? where will all of this lead eventually? all
of this seeking and meditating? you know and we try to imagine what it is, or what it will be like, when
we are in some sort of heightened enlightened god-like state or something like that right?
that's a common and understandable way of thinking for us to have... but if we don't move beyond these
thoughts themselves, beyond wondering about what's going to happen in the future, then
we may not understand the deeper truth behind it, and part of understanding the truth behind all of
these questions is in understanding that the ego THINKS that it must become more, or to learn more,
or to be more spiritual in order to achieve the goal of enlightenment; so this is a very tricky
pursuit that can become even more trickier when we are actively living from a state of egoic desire
and desperate kind of neediness to be more than what we are now, which is ultimately an illusion,
it's an illusion to think that you will become more in the future, you know, sure,
your mind experiences and memories and knowledge can accumulate more, but what you actually are
in your innermost essence is always whole, always at that so-called goal, it is really always
enlightened ~ but when we speak of this we have to be mindful that it is impossible to imagine
what enlightenment is; in order to understand it you can only Be it, and only then will you get it
so enlightenment is not about cultivating some wonderful thought-form, but it is more about
a state of profound Being and realization; to be rooted in Being is to be aware of at an
illuminating and exposing level, the activity and movement and play of your thoughts, in other words;
the play of illusion within you; in other words the full comprehension and understanding of the self
or the ego; enlightenment implies seeing through the veil, through the illusory way of perceiving
reality through the filter of dreams and unconsciousness, which can either be
on a individual level or collective level this is what is called in buddhism; "Maya"...
so at first when we seek enlightenment we usually are playing the game of
being a "spiritual seeker", but that is only part of the journey eventually one has to
realize that being identified as a seeker, who will find something in the future, is actually
paradoxically counterproductive, because you cannot find enlightenment in the future and actively
thinking that you will becomes a habit that you never really reach as long as you stay in that
sort of state of being and level of understanding, enlightenment is something that blossoms
here and now through deep realization... another common question i get asked is "Gene are you
enlightened?" I usually respond with something like "do you know that it would be extremely rare
for an enlightened person to actually say they are enlightened?" and "why?" people ask,
well because one effect of being enlightened is to realize how much you do not know, contrary to
the western idea that the more one knows the wiser they are, however in terms of consciousness
the more one realizes that they truly know nothing on the deeper level of reality
is the beginning of true wisdom; having the inner strength to let go of all your ideas and delusions
about the world and having the courage to be empty in the presence of direct experience and life is
the beginning of this real wisdom that comes from enlightenment, becoming enlightened and taking joy
in the fact that you know nothing, points towards the fact that enlightenment is not an end goal
but in many ways it is the start of the path, the true spiritual path, it is the start of realizing
that you weren't enlightened on the level of your mind to begin with or any part of you to
begin; with that's if you're really honest with yourself of course you have to be tremendously
sincere and honest to realize that you do not know as much as you thought, until then life
is a fool's game fooling ourselves and others thinking that we know when we in fact do not.
So you see enlightenment is not something that once you are it, you are just that permanently but
it can happen at times, or it can not happen, and on top of that there are many multi-dimensional
layers and degrees to enlightenment, just as there are many layers and complexities to
consciousness too, enlightenment is, by all means, not a simple state when you try to understand it
intellectually - but by all means it is a supremely simple state when understood from that deeper part
of you that we're trying to get at ~ this isn't a university degree or some kind of scientific
research; you cannot rationalize it, you cannot hold on to it, it is really the opposite of all of that
and from the perspective of the level of consciousness from our ego, enlightenment seems
like something that is kind of boring, because it's like; you've reached a goal and that's it
but it's really not like that and the ego just sees it this way because
it always wants to get somewhere, it always wants to go somewhere in the future, it always wants to
come to a conclusion, to finish, to achieve, to reach a climax, right? to give an example from one of my
recent videos... so when you become enlightened, it is far from just being in a state where everything is
finished and you know everything, but in fact it is only a purely joyful state in which imbues every
moment with pure learning and understanding and wisdom; like a constant crescendo of music
where everything makes sense, this is the real learning and in reality the state of the ego
is the "boring" state where things don't make sense and thus learning becomes
incapacitated and retarded... now of course, you can only intuit and understand all of this for yourself
when you really devote yourself thoroughly to the transcendence of the ego and doing all of
the real work of liberating consciousness, but while doing this the mind will usually ask: "is
not working towards a goal, a fantasy in the future, not counterproductive and ultimately an illusion?"
well in many ways, yes, this is how the mind never comes to its realizations or goals but stays
in a state of speculation and skepticism, because of the way it's created and understands its image,
its skewed image of reality since we were born - to realize the many ways that the mind
and the ego does this and to end that illusion IS the process and unfoldment of enlightenment...
and so for many enlightenment isn't something fun initially, because we usually have many ideas and
fantasies and beliefs and false conceptions about ourselves and the world and, you know, we may regard
to those things very dearly or be very proud about them or identified with them, so most people
find genuine enlightenment painful or scary, it's painful for most people to let go of all of that,
but is this pain also part of the illusion? of course, but it will only be experienced as pain so
as long as you don't realize that it's just part of the pain and that the pain is just something
you are still identified with, or that there is still a part of you that is holding on...
so does the fact that there's nothing you can "do" or "think" about to become enlightened
mean that we just do nothing and hope enlightenment magically comes about? yes and
no - you know there's still absolutely something you can do and it's all of this spiritual work
right? because you know meditation and everything is not pointless especially when done right; there
is still this cultivation of aliveness and this gravity to moving towards a deeper sense of being
intensely here and now, being attentive to our life profoundly, from moment to moment, internally and
externally, you know saving our energy, breathing, being contemplative being in these deeper states
of consciousness; this all leads to being grounded in yourself and gaining that clear light within
that shows us understanding wherever we place our minds... this all does lead to enlightenment
so as long as we stay on the level of our being and have awareness about all our chaotic and
doubtful thoughts and don't become identified with all that, there is a difference between wanting
to achieve something and sincere genuine spiritual aspiration that comes from a longing to understand
our experience and reality; genuine spiritual aspiration is akin to how a flower innately feels
the instincts to bloom, or the bird to make its nest, or a bee to create honey, does nature think
about these things in order to get that done? does it get upset or depressed when it can't do what
it's meant to? no, it always happens perfectly as it's meant to without strain or struggle... so it is
a paradox to say there's nothing you can do about enlightenment, but at the same time it is something
that happens intensely and beautifully and you can consciously move towards it
the truth is found between both ends of the spectrum; in the middle way of duality,
and moving through this middle way, between all our thoughts and questions and doubts
and motivations, we learn to recognize what is illusory and what is not from this inner, silent
awareness and the intelligence that comes from that, and so enlightenment
is this ending of illusion through realization, and thus it is also the beginning of seeing the truth
of reality, which is part of the greater whole, the Greater Reality, the objective reality, and through
these purified perspectives we enter more profound and intelligent dimensions of consciousness...
enlightenment does not mean you suddenly know everything, it means that you have developed
a sense to see the 'Great Reality', and therefore can start learning properly and intuitively. It means
that you are no longer imprisoned and shackled by your own conditioning and unconsciousness,
you no longer need to debate ideas but you can sense them and their truth,
it means to literally be: "en'LIGHT'ened" ~ as in the light enters you, or you enter the light,
it means to be devoid of darkness within; it is the illuminating and arising of light within oneself
that fills the higher centers of your being, which you could call the head and heart, this
"en*light*ening" can even sometimes be felt within the head or heart physically too especially perhaps
during meditation ~ so enlightenment is this active movement towards light, the moment you
truly realize that you are not your thoughts but the light of awareness behind your thoughts; that
is enlightenment, the moment you realize that you are far more than the idea and image of yourself;
that is enlightenment, the moment you realize that the idea of others being separate is an illusion;
that is enlightenment, the moment you truly realize that you, who you experience
as a separate confused unenlightened being is not actually separate from the whole
and the universe at all; that is enlightenment, you see the observation of unenlightenment
is enlightenment - the moment you truly understand many of your problems are answered when you're
in a state of love and surrender to everything that is; that is enlightenment, the moment you
realize that consciousness is interconnected far beyond your body and that knowledge can come from
this connection within rather than books; that is enlightenment ~ enlightenment is not a becoming of
something, it is not about being happier or better, in reality you don't become enlightened you just
become more 'undarkened', you see we always talk about the light, but it's because we do not know
what real darkness is, which is why we are so easily shrouded by it, if we knew what darkness
was, we would easily overcome it; and to become undarkened you become less of "yourself", and so
enlightenment is actually a destructive process to let go of everything that is not truth and all the
psychological complexities and unconsciousness of the ego; it's to look beyond the veil of illusion
beliefs and the charades and circus of life, it's to stop living in a fantasy world and wake
up out of your own individual dream and also stop being enchanted by the collective dream
of others and the world that's been fed to our own conditioning since we can remember, enlightenment
is the complete destruction of almost everything we initially thought to be true, and through this
there is an arising of a pure, fresh, timeless and ageless mind which is necessary to perceive what
is actually true ~ with the logic of our ego now we say "when i become enlightened everything will
be great, i will understand everything and have peace and wisdom"... but actually the opposite is true,
you have to find that peace and understanding first and then you will become enlightened...
and paradoxically, you are already enlightened you just need to realize; it it's like a glass of
muddy water which is your darkened mind, you don't make the glass clearer by shaking it and thinking
many thoughts or feeling disturbing emotions; you make it clear by holding it still and letting
the mud and thoughts fall to the bottom, only then can light shine through the water when it's made
clear... and what happens when the light of pure consciousness can shine through the water? well,
there is also the realization that there was nothing to be enlightened about in the first place...
because we realize that we are the light itself and that the light that shines
through the glass also connects us to the light that is outside of the glass,
so what should we become enlightened about when we are already all of this? so some of you may be able
to see now that it's less about changing the play of form and thoughts on the level of your mind,
but instead to shift our center of gravity and awareness to the deeper parts of us that
are already connected to enlightenment, that part of us is always whole, always enlightened,
always full, and doesn't need to feel that it needs to add anything more to itself; that is our source
of fullness and blissfulness of life ~ through these enlightened states we're much more equipped to
look through the facade of illusion, through all of this fiction and dream of collective human drama
and all our personal issues, the enlightened person looks around the world and laughs at how serious
everyone is and realizes and is humbled and joyed by the impermanence of it all, so the enlightened
person finds great happiness and wonder in impermanence, while the unenlightened only finds
sadness, sorrow and depression in what he thinks is just pure misfortune; the unenlightened person says
"what is the meaning of life?" and the enlightened person says "the meaning of life IS life", but of
course the unenlightened person can't see this because of all that muddy water within,
unenlightenment is the unawareness of the magnificence and beauty of everything that
is ordinary and ~ As Above, So Below ~ if one cannot see this majesty in experience and creation
itself then one doesn't see it in themselves either or who they experience as themself...
they only experience themselves as this shallow thinking entity when there is far more to that
reality, far more to what is on the surface layer of our thoughts, and so enlightenment goes back
to the saying of "Temet Nosce" knowing thyself, and if you know yourself, you will know the world,
and that is how enlightenment is understood as knowing everything, not on an intellectual level,
but on a much more vast and spacious and formless level, what more logic do you need than that? but
of course you know in the end for those who are still perhaps confused and that's fine and natural
i wouldn't personally get too caught up in the idea of enlightenment at all, it's just a concept
after all, a label, you can become enlightened to a degree tonight with a good meditation session
by shining the light within yourself, you know doing this every day, aspiring to enlightenment,
knowing ourselves, and learning spiritually, is walking on the path of enlightenment,
and there is so much to learn we don't need to be so hard on ourselves, we are alive in these
physical bodies after all, and life is very hard suffering itself and as long as we are learning
from all our life experience and suffering IS a path of learning in itself, and so as long as we
are alive enlightenment is not an end goal and it's also crucial to keep in mind that
what's more important than any kind of end goal is that the enjoyment and appreciation of the
journey along the way is very important, or else you'll miss all of the signposts on the way there...
I hope that helps some of you who have been asking this question I'd also be interested in hearing
about how you would describe what enlightenment is; if you want to share please feel free to do
so with all of us below and just before i go a quick shout out to Pzecc, space opera, Cafeb,
Kevin, and Bullwey who raised his pledge and also Hayley who pledged a higher amount than
what's offered in the Patreon so thank you all for joining I hope you benefit from the group and the
extra information that's provided there, if you'd like to support the channel too and join a group
of fellow enlightened seekers then just follow the link in the description below, and if you
have any questions as always just ask too below ~ this is Gene and I'll see you on the next episode.
